treeQuadrature.integrators.distributed_gp_integrator module¶

class treeQuadrature.integrators.distributed_gp_integrator.DistributedGpTreeIntegrator(base_N: int, max_n_samples: int, integral: IterativeGpIntegral, tree: Tree | None = None, sampler: Sampler | None = None, max_container_samples: int = 200, min_container_samples: int = 20, max_iterations_per_container: int = 5)[source]¶

Bases: DistributedTreeIntegrator

Integrator for gaussian process container integrals that distribute samples dynamically based on performance gain.

split¶

method to split the tree

Type:

Split

integral¶

an integrator that takes previous_samples and is able to extend from there.

Note: integral.n_samples will be ignored

Type:

IterativeGpIntegral

base_N¶

number of initial samples used to construct the tree

Type:

int

P¶

stopping criteria for building tree.

largest container should not have more than P samples

Type:

int

sampler¶

sampler to use when problem does nove have method rvs

Type:

Sampler

max_container_samples¶

maximum number of samples to allocate to a container

Type:

int

min_container_samples¶

minimum number of samples to allocate to a container.

This is also used for the initial round

Type:

int

max_iterations_per_container¶

maximum number of iterations to allocate to a container

Type:

int

integrate_containers(containers: List[Container], problem: Problem, compute_std: bool = False, verbose: bool = False)[source]¶
treeQuadrature.integrators.distributed_gp_integrator.individual_container_integral(integral: IterativeGpIntegral, cont: Container, integrand: callable, return_std: bool, n_samples: int, previous_samples: dict | None = None)[source]¶

Perform the container integral with the option to pass in previous samples.

Parameters:

  • integral (IterativeGpIntegral) – The integral method to be used.

  • cont (Container) – The container to perform the integral on.

  • integrand (callable) – The integrand function.

  • return_std (bool) – Whether to return the standard deviation of the integral.

  • n_samples (int) – Number of samples to draw for this container in this iteration.

  • previous_samples (dict) – containers are keys and values are

Returns:

  • integral_results (dict) – The results of the integral.

  • cont (Container) – The container used for the integral.

  • new_samples (tuple of np.ndarray) – Updated tuple containing all samples used.

treeQuadrature.integrators.smc_integrator module¶

class treeQuadrature.integrators.smc_integrator.SmcIntegrator(N: int, sampler: Sampler | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: Integrator

Simple Monte Carlo integrator: Draw N samples from prior, take sample mean of likelihood values at these samples.

Only works for BayesProblem

Parameters:

  • N (int) – Number of samples to draw.

  • sampler

treeQuadrature.integrators.tree_integrator module¶

class treeQuadrature.integrators.tree_integrator.TreeIntegrator(base_N: int, tree: Tree | None = None, integral: ContainerIntegral | None = None, sampler: Sampler | None = None, parallel: bool = True, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Integrator

integrate_containers(containers: List[Container], problem: Problem, compute_std: bool = False, verbose: bool = False)[source]¶
treeQuadrature.integrators.tree_integrator.individual_container_integral(integral: ContainerIntegral, cont: Container, integrand: callable, return_std: bool)[source]¶

Perform integration on an individual container.

Parameters:

  • integral (ContainerIntegral) – The integral method to be used.

  • cont (Container) – The container on which to perform the integration.

  • integrand (callable) – The integrand function to be integrated.

  • return_std (bool) – Whether to return the standard deviation of the integral.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the results of the integration. - ‘estimate’ : the estimated integral value - ‘std’ : the standard deviation of the integral value

Return type:

dict

class treeQuadrature.integrators.vegas_integrator.VegasIntegrator(N: int, n_iter: int, n_adaptive: int = 5)[source]¶

Bases: Integrator

Integrator that uses the VEGAS algorithm for adaptive Monte Carlo integration.

Parameters:

  • N (int) – Number of samples to draw per iteration.

  • n_iter (int) – Number of adaptive iterations to perform.
